message_1: Suppose you have a plaintext message "HELLO" that you want to encrypt using a one-time pad. You also have a random sequence of numbers "58274" to use as your key. Using modular arithmetic, encrypt the message and provide the ciphertext.
message_2:
To encrypt the message "HELLO" using a one-time pad with the key "58274", we will first convert the letters of the message and the key into their corresponding numerical values using the following mapping: A=0, B=1, C=2, ..., Z=25.

The numerical values for "HELLO" are:
H (7), E (4), L (11), L (11), O (14)

The numerical values for the key "58274" are:
5, 8, 2, 7, 4

Now, we will use modular arithmetic to encrypt the message. We will add the numerical values of the message and the key, and then take the result modulo 26 to get the encrypted numerical values.

(7 + 5) % 26 = 12
(4 + 8) % 26 = 12
(11 + 2) % 26 = 13
(11 + 7) % 26 = 18
(14 + 4) % 26 = 18

The encrypted numerical values are:
12, 12, 13, 18, 18

Now, we will convert these numerical values back to letters using the same mapping as before:
12 -> M, 12 -> M, 13 -> N, 18 -> S, 18 -> S

So, the ciphertext is "MMNSS".
